Posts.Content: mommydoxie wrote: I've had chemo and whole brain radiation.  It only took about 3 months post-chemo to get my hair back to a length I felt comfortable going without a wig, etc.  It's been almost 6 months post-WBR and I have a head of dark fuzz with a mohawk patch of bald.  I'm concerned I'll never get hair on the top of my head.  Has anyone else experienced similar inconsistent hair regrowth on your head and what did you do about it? Dx 12/13/2010, IDC, 4cm, Stage IV, mets, ER-/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bald patches with hair regrowth post-radiation mommydoxie bhd1

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 12:01PM mommydoxie wrote: I just finished my 6th round (every 3 weeks) of Taxotere combined with Herceptin and Carboplatin.  Taxotere is a very powerful drug, but also apparently very effective.  I had many side effects, some that came and went and were replaced with new ones, and some that lasted throughout but got progressively worse.  Of all, the worst were nails hurting and some starting to lift up from the nailbed, and fatigue.  All in all, I consider the side effects more annoyances than anything else, and I have been able to work my job throughout the whole process.  I wish your mom the very best.  Just tell her to take it one day at a time and know that there is light at the end of the tunnel.
Posts.Title: is taxotere any good? curepink mommydoxie
